name: Pentadrone
lore: Pentadrones are five-sided, starfish-shaped modrons that serve as law enforcement and minor administrators in the modron hierarchy. They can process five tasks simultaneously, making them formidable overseers. Pentadrones communicate directly with the higher-ranking hierarch modrons and relay commands to the quadrones beneath them. In combat, a pentadrone can exhale a cloud of paralysis gas from its central orifice, immobilizing foes while its five arms batter them into submission.

traits.name: Axiomatic Mind
traits.description: The modron can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

traits.name: Disintegration
traits.description: If the modron dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

multiattack.description: The pentadrone makes five Arm attacks.

actions.name: Arm
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Paralysis Gas
actions.description: The pentadrone exhales gas in a 30-foot Cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have the Paralyzed condition for 1 minute. A Paralyzed creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

onSuccess.effects: The effect ends on the creature.

savingThrow.targets: the Paralyzed creature at the end of each of its turns
